Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2008 10:41AM - edited Jul 25, 2008 10:44AM by Dee1 Thanks for your response. And I must say... I was a bit surprised when the surgeon didn't offer to aspirate the lump and/or remove it.  When I asked the surgeon about it... she said... "the lump is too small... that it would be too hard to find it with a needle". That surprises me because... my fingers find the lump IMMEDIATELY!  My lump doesn't feel like a pea or bean... like others describe. It doesn't feel like a little rock. It just feels different... and at times I DO feel/sense a bit of soreness. I suppose I do need to get a mammogram... so at least there is something to refer to...
Posts.Title: Where.... What... How.... Why...When Dee1 nowheregirl

Posts.Content: Dee1 wrote: Hello. I'm new to this forum... and new to this world of... Where.. what... how... why... when... CANCER! I suppose I'm not different than others who question cancer.   Where is it? What is it? How do I deal with it? Why me? When should I panic? Am I in denial of WHAT I'm feeling? About a year ago... While taking a shower... I discovered a lump on my right breast... towards the upper outter side... near my armpit.  My first reaction was to deny what I felt and never to return to that part of my body.  However, that truly is impossible. Since I felt the lump its as though it was a magnet pulling my hand to it. I couldn't stop feeling it. I wouldn't stop feeling it. From my knowledge... nobody in my family has ever been diagnosed with breast cancer.  I must say.. that DID give me a teeny tiny bit of relief. But after reading about breast cancer... I realize now.. that it can happen to anybody... any age. I am 39 years old. I have NO children. Breast size... 36D.    Long story getting longer... but I promise to get to the point. I did indeed go to the doctor after I found the lump. My primary doctor sent me to get an ultrasound and referred me to a surgeon.  The ultrasound showed that there were 3 lumps.... of which 1 had grey marks in it.  I was sent to the surgeon. The surgeon quickly felt my breast...with both hands... side-to-side... up-and-down. Then looked at the ultrasound and said. "You're fine".  "Nothing to worry over".  She did give me a referral to get a mammogram. Just for the records, I was told. I didn't get the mammorgram done after people telling me that the ultrasound sees more than the mammogram.  Is a mammogram necessary IF an ultrasound sees deeper? Where:   Lump in upper right breast What:     What do I do about the lump? How:       How do I know the lump is still "normal"? Why:      Why did the lump become a lump? Why didn't the surgeon want the lump removed?  When:    When do I stop worring? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Where.... What... How.... Why...When Dee1 nowheregirl

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2008 04:45PM Dee1 wrote: Its interesting to me when people say "the only good lump is the one in the jar". I can agree that seems to be the best place for a lump. Better in a jar... than in me..... But having said that.... I have read many times... that scar tissue can be quite a problem too. Sooooo.... is it better to deal with the lump... or deal with the scar tissue?
Posts.Title: Life sentence, even with no cancer? theonlyfalco AnnNYC

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2008 03:58PM Dee1 wrote: " Many women here feel that 'the best lump is the lump in the jar' - in other words, feel best in getting things biopsied (at least if they aren't cysts.)  Cysts can feel hard if they are deep. If your lumps shrink and swell with your menstrual period - well, cancer doesn't shrink like that - cancer is 'uncontrolled growth'. " I found one lump on my right breast... but when I had the ultrasound done... it found 3 lumps (cysts). One lump had some grey in it???? Anyway.... from what I'm feeling... the lump feels the same to me. Same size... same location. What does differ... is sometimes I feel soreness. But, I think its a montly thing... as both breast feel sore. So.... if the lump (cysts) stay the same size.... should I be more or less concerned?  The one thing I've noticed... it doesn't/hasn't gone away or gotten smaller.
Posts.Title: Life sentence, even with no cancer? theonlyfalco AnnNYC
